intro: Impatiens balsamina var. coccinea, commonly known as the red impatiens, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its vibrant red, trumpet-shaped flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers moist, well-drained soil. It thrives in partial shade and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. The species is also notable for its rapid growth and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
